pr_title: [RW-4235][risk=no] Log when a user observes a held notebook lock

timeline.bodyText: If it's useful, we can either fire an event metric for this to StackDriver, or add a log-based metric.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

timeline.bodyText:
Looks good as of this writing. Thanks for being the first guinea pig.
In terms of timing, I might hold off and use a single metric that has attachments after #2934 is in. The paradigm there is a metric like NOTEBOOK_CHECK_BY_LOCK_STATUS and then a key like AttachmentKey.NOTEBOOK_LOCK_STATUS with values locked and unlocked. (This would be an EventMetric instead of a GaugeMetric in the new scheme.)
No harm in leaving this in place in the meantime and adding rather than replacing these, especially since I can't yet guarantee the above functionality is in the next build. And of course, now that you've gone through the process here, any comments on the other PR are doubly appreciated.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -29,6 +29,11 @@
   NOTEBOOK_SAVE("notebook_save", "Save (or create) a notebook"),
   NOTEBOOK_CLONE("notebook_clone", "Clone (duplicate) a notebook"),
   NOTEBOOK_DELETE("notebook_delete", "Delete a notebook"),
+  NOTEBOOK_CHECK_LOCKED(

replies.bodyText: I saw that go by - sure, that would be preferred, I will wait for it since this isn't particularly urgent.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.bodyText: style nit/trick: if you just have a line that just says final MonitoringViews lockMetric;, the compiler will keep you honest that it's initialized exactly once, taking all branches into account. That way if someone adds another branch later, they won't forget to assign it as appropriate.
timeline.author: jaycarlton

replies.bodyText: I expected you would leave a final-related comment here. I'm aware that Java supports doing it the way you describe, but my preference is to initialize to a happy-path default value, and then override in exceptional cases.
replies.author: calbach

timeline.author: jaycarlton
jaycarlton

+  NOTEBOOK_LOCK_CHECK(
+      "notebook_lock_check",
+      "Counts of notebook availability due to locking, as observed by the caller",

timeline.bodyText: Just a heads up: I'm about 75% sure that Stackdriver considers the Labels (tags) list to be part of the metric descriptor, so if you want to add another tag in the future, we have to either drop this one and replace it, or add a new one. I'll put this in the docs.
timeline.author: jaycarlton
